intro: Spiesia stracheyana, commonly known as the Strachey's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and hairy, fleshy stems. Native to the tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
